answerText: fractional quantum Hall effect [accept FQHE; prompt on partial answers; do not accept integer quantum hall effect][10] While the fractional quantum Hall effect still has many open questions, especially regarding excited Landau levels, the integer quantum Hall effect is better understood. The integer quantum Hall effect is useful in precisely measuring this quantity, the coupling constant in electromagnetism,, which has an approximate value of 1/137.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 4 | 9 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This effect is generally explained by composite fermion theory. For 10 points each: [10] Name this 2D effect first explained by Laughlin with a test wavefunction. It cannot be modeled as a perturbation and it sees resistance mostly quantized by rational filling factors with odd denominators, although some filling factors with even denominators have been observed.
